pull.title: guix: bump time-machine to 1aa8dfaeec3c6e4e587aadf7440246f7c5c04b9f
pull.body:
Needed for https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/30210. This doesn't switch runtimes, because upstream is
still configured to use the old runtime. See:
https://git.savannah.gnu.org/cgit/guix.git/commit/?id=17188be0f723e00377b21b767f5447d7938a116e.

git-mimimal `2.45.1` -> `2.45.2`
Kernel Headers `6.1.92` -> `6.1.100`
LLVM `18.1.6` -> `18.1.8`
mingw-w64 `11.0.1` -> `12.0.0`
NSIS `3.09` -> `3.10`
patch `2.7.6` -> `2.7.6-0.f144b35`

Based on #30511.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#30511](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30511) (guix: GCC 12 consolidation by fanquake)
* [#29881](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29881) (guix: use GCC 13 to builds releases by fanquake)
* [#25573](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25573) ([POC] guix: produce a fully `-static-pie` bitcoind by fanquake)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
~~Fixed the cross-arch non-determinism by patching the store patch out of winpthreads.~~

[`568371e366c44926...`](https://drahtbot.space/guix/bitcoin/bitcoin/8d573611575c3fa66f08407aa9b02f91b29a94c3/guix_build.log) | [`72be752ea73c6b91...`](https://drahtbot.space/guix/bitcoin/bitcoin/b7b271c2f4cb7d9fba7923d2ce383425839fcc18/guix_build.log) | | guix_build.log.diff | | [`fb579b03dbb83923...`](https://drahtbot.space/guix/bitcoin/bitcoin/b7b271c2f4cb7d9fba7923d2ce383425839fcc18/guix_build.log.diff) |

This is the problematic commit: https://github.com/mingw-w64/mingw-w64/commit/9a80e57890f887afd60e0b019d1c6698351fd470. Which, by no-longer using it's internal definitions, causes GCC to reach for intrinsics , which left a (different per arch) path to the `/gnu/store/` in the debug info. This pointed out a different issue, which is that the path was to GCC 11 libs, rather than 12. I'll open a new PR to fix winpthreads being compiled with 11 rather than 12, and then come back here.

verification.payload:
tree 6f2e2934451ec0ca97520ebe616ddfd273f4b92a
parent fa0b5d68823b69f4861b002bbfac2fd36ed46356
author fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1721733594 +0100
committer fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1721810595 +0100

guix: consolidate back to GCC 12 toolchain for all HOSTS

Using GCC 11 for the macOS build hasn't been required since #21778, and
at this point, given a toolchain is still needed (#30206), it makes more
sense to (re-)use 12, rather than make all builders compile another
GCC toolchain.

events.message:
guix: consolidate back to GCC 12 toolchain for all HOSTS

Using GCC 11 for the macOS build hasn't been required since #21778, and
at this point, given a toolchain is still needed (#30206), it makes more
sense to (re-)use 12, rather than make all builders compile another
GCC toolchain.

verification.payload:
tree b4493c82322166b8456d5a039a61d9b832a82876
parent 115e241ec67d5dbf224bceceb6bb55085e3be415
author fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1721724124 +0100
committer fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1721810595 +0100

guix: use GCC 12.4.0 over 12.3.0

Our patch might be merged upstream soon:
https://lists.gnu.org/archive/html/guix-patches/2024-06/msg01025.html.

In the mean time, it's easy us for us to use the newer version of GCC.

events.message:
guix: use GCC 12.4.0 over 12.3.0

Our patch might be merged upstream soon:
https://lists.gnu.org/archive/html/guix-patches/2024-06/msg01025.html.

In the mean time, it's easy us for us to use the newer version of GCC.

verification.payload:
tree d3a872fe7c312c81b75d282a5b2cb6d2cd4be0a2
parent 529dc4b00b02d75867767ef12124a30b2267731d
author fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1721665522 +0100
committer fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1721810595 +0100

guix: use gcc-12 to compile winpthreads

Currently, winpthreads is compiled with GCC 11, when we want to be using
GCC 12 for all compilation.

events.message:
guix: use gcc-12 to compile winpthreads

Currently, winpthreads is compiled with GCC 11, when we want to be using
GCC 12 for all compilation.

author fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1721401862 +0100

guix: patch /gnu/store paths out of winpthreads

At the same time, align the docs for all patches that do the same thing.

Needed for 30210. This doesn't switch runtimes, because upstream is
still configured to use the old runtime. See:
